channel.title: How do I save a file as .cfg?
channel.description:
Well, I opened my autospawn.cfg to add a new line so I opened it up with notepad, tried saving as .cfg but it would only save as notepad.
How do I save as .cfg?

item.title: How do I save a file as .cfg?
item.dc:creator: @Killerswan Killerswan
item.description:
@Killerswan wrote:

Deathclock:

Yeah, when I save it I save it as (name.cfg) but it still has the notepad icon and opens with it.

Thats because u made notepad the default program to open .cfg files, windows remembers these things this is good as long as you can see to the right it says CFG or something of resemblance you have nothing to worry about…

Read full topic
item.source: How do I save a file as .cfg?

item.title: How do I save a file as .cfg?
item.dc:creator: @someone2 someone2
item.description:
@someone2 wrote:

At notepad, press save as, where it says “*.txt files” or something, change it to all files. Save it as (filenamehere).cfg. Try that.

Read full topic
item.source: How do I save a file as .cfg?

item.title: How do I save a file as .cfg?
item.dc:creator: @Killerswan Killerswan
item.description:
@Killerswan wrote:

…
Does it say its a .txt or a .cfg? if it still says .cfg then your perfectly okay it will compile and run still.
